title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest made No. 55 iconic in the NFL, a tradition started by Junior Seau at USC.
McGinest wore No. 55 for the Patriots from 1994-2005, contributing to three Super Bowl wins.
Junior Seau respectfully requested to wear No. 55 in New England after McGinest, highlighting mutual respect.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13.0 inches during the storm.
Northeastern Massachusetts experienced the most snowfall on February 7, 2026, according to the National Weather Service.
Significant snow was reported in Bristol County with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches and Rehoboth 6.5 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC as the Patriots face the Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Tirico will work alongside analyst Cris Collinsworth, with Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung as sideline reporters.
Following the Super Bowl, Tirico will also host NBC's Olympic studio program 'Primetime in Milan' from Levi's Stadium.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, marking Patriots' 12th and Seahawks' 4th appearance.
Drake Maye could become the youngest Super Bowl-winning quarterback ever if the Patriots win at 23 years old.
Seahawks had the NFL's top scoring defense this season, while the Patriots ranked second in regular season scoring.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid before coaching his first Super Bowl with the Patriots.
Vrabel also relied on Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, who has experience in 10 Super Bowls.
Patriots practiced Super Bowl halftime simulation using advice from Belichick and Reid, playing music like Bad Bunny.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to break a tie with Pittsburgh for the most Super Bowl wins by a franchise at seven.
Quarterback Drake Maye could join elite company as the first second-year quarterback to win the Super Bowl since 2014.
Mike Vrabel seeks to become the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both a player and a coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to strengthen his Hall of Fame credentials with a potential Super Bowl LX victory.
Diggs, at 32, seeks his first Super Bowl win, with accolades including four Pro Bowls and two All-Pro nods.
Diggs ranks 38th in all-time receiving yards and hopes to climb into the top 15 before retiring.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was named to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots, including the famous 2002 snow game against the Raiders.
He holds the record for most career points in the NFL with 2,673 across 24 seasons, 10 with the Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a long halftime break for the Patriots during their final practice at Stanford Stadium.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye fully practiced despite a recent shoulder issue and was among the last to leave the field.
Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited in practice due to injuries ahead of the Super Bowl.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye and Sam Darnold to lead Patriots and Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, both former No. 3 picks.
Patriots and Seahawks feature top defenses; Maye and Darnold's ball security pivotal in the game's outcome.
New England's Milton Williams and Seattle's Jaxon Smith-Njigba are key players to watch outside of the quarterbacks.
